meanings.definition: A person who touches or makes physical contact with something.
meanings.sent1: The touchers gently held the fragile vase.
meanings.sent2: The children were curious touchers, exploring everything they found.
meanings.sent3: The touchers at the art museum were so careful, it was like they were handling precious gems.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like the touchers of a skilled artist, leaving an impression that lingered long after she spoke.
meanings.sent5: The touchers of the sculptor brought life to the cold stone, creating beauty from rough material.

meanings.definition: Devices or tools used for touching or making contact with objects.
meanings.sent1: The touchers in the lab were designed for delicate experiments.
meanings.sent2: She used the touchers to carefully adjust the settings on the machine.
meanings.sent3: The touchers in the toolbox seemed to have a mind of their own, always getting tangled up.
meanings.sent4: The touchers of technology have revolutionized how we interact with the world around us.
meanings.sent5: The touchers of the robot were precise and efficient, never making a mistake in their movements.

meanings.definition: A type of sensory experience involving physical contact.
meanings.sent1: The soft touchers of the fabric brought comfort to her skin.
meanings.sent2: The baby explored the world through touchers, feeling every texture with curiosity.
meanings.sent3: The touchers of the massage therapist seemed to erase all worries and stress.
meanings.sent4: The touchers of the warm sunlight on her face made her smile with contentment.
meanings.sent5: The touchers of the ocean waves against the shore created a soothing melody in her ears.
